In Mathlib, there is the following instance:

instance Real.measurableSpace : MeasurableSpace ℝ :=
  borel ℝ

I can't find a corresponding one for R^n. If I do, for example Vector ℝ 2, this is not a-priori a MeasurableSpace. Is there some canonical way to talk about R^n that understands what the opens are so that borel may be used? Thanks!
We have registered a measurable space structure for the space Fin n → ℝ, so you can use this one.
I think the standard ways of talking about R^n are either EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin n) (with the L^2 norm) or Fin n → ℝ (with the L^∞ norm), and both have a BorelSpace instance.
Björn Wehlin has marked this topic as resolved.
